item.title: SQLite: show UTC timestamp as local time
item.description: A business unit asked me to compile some trading volume stats by trading hour. The good thing is that I have the following in SQLite database; the bad thing is the database stores the timestamp as follows: trade idamount donetimestamp 11002019-06-01 01:01:01.111111 22002019-06-01 02:02:02.222222 33002019-06-01 03:03:03.333333 ... 1000100002019-06-24 23:59:59.999999 timestamp column is stored as a string1, so rather than doing timezone arithmetic, I used SQLite’s built-in date/time functions instead:
